repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

body:
This is just an attempt to finish off https://github.com/cython/cython/pull/3050, to put `PyMem_Calloc` and `PyMem_RawCalloc` in a pxd file.

I've:
* removed Cython's forwarding of `PyMem_RawMalloc` -> `PyMem_Malloc` (etc) because replacing a `nogil` with a `gil` function seems very dodgy to me.
* Made the tests so that they only run on Python 3.5+

the alternative option (which I'm happy to change to) would be:
* forward `PyMem_RawMalloc` -> system `malloc` (and write replacement functions for `PyMem_RawCalloc` and `PyMem_Calloc`)
* run the tests on every Python version.

I chose the former option because I'm not convinced by the need to backport bits of the C API unless Cython itself needs it.

commit.message:
Fix #3047: Add PyMem_(Raw)Calloc to cpython.mem

CPython added PyMem_RawCalloc and PyMem_Calloc in version 3.5. I did not
in include a version guard for 3.4 because PyObject_Calloc was also
added in 3.5 but it's already in this file without a version guard.

I updated comments for other functions to reflect PyMem_Calloc but not
PyMem_RawCalloc to match comments' currently only referencing
PyMem_Malloc and friends.

I did not modify Cython/Utility/ModuleSetupCode.c, where
PyMem_RawMalloc, PyMem_RawRealloc, and PyMem_RawFree are #defined for
Python 3.3 because (a) I couldn't figure out where these were being used
and (b) they're defined to their non-raw versions, which strikes me as
dangerous since the Raw versions allow use without the GIL but the
non-Raw versions do not.

Finally, I updated the tests in cpython_capi.pyx. I'm never sure when
compilers decide code is dead and just ignore it, so I tried actually to
write to the memory and return data from it. I can't figure out how to
run Cython's tests, so... fingers crossed.

Fix tests

1. Replace sizeof(*s) with sizeof(short) per
https://github.com/cython/cython/pull/3050/files#r307708557 (and
besides, Cython dereferences pointers as s[0], not *s).

2. Replace free(m) with free(s)â€”this typo would have freed the address
in the uninitialized stack variable m rather than the initialized
variable s. This was blatently undefined behavior.

commit.message:
Fix failing test assertion

The array entries couldn't be zero right after setting them to 1 and 3.
Reordering the lines of code should make the assertion work now.

Reordering the lines of code should make the assertion work now.

commit.message:
TEST: Skip `run.cpython-capi` test on Python < 3.5

Python has no `PyMem_Calloc` before version 3.5, so the `run.cpython_capi` test
doesn't work. This change suggested by @da-woods at
https://github.com/cython/cython/pull/3050#issuecomment-640013866

Moved Py<3.5 tests to a different file, removed wrappers

Removed wrappers for PyMem_Raw* because they were unsafe
